repo.description: Python binding for Project-Tox the skype replacement.
repo.name: py-toxcore-c

body: @grayhatter --- This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/py-toxcore-c/30)

comment_data.body: this shouldn't be `TOX_MAX_NAME_LENGTH` it should be public key size
No need for memset. Every byte will be set by the tox function.

On errors, we don't touch buf again.

If we do touch it, there is a bug. If there was no error and any byte was not set, there is a bug. Both these bugs are caught in tests using ASAN, so it's valuable to leave buf uninitialised, otherwise those bugs would be masked.
Now you probably want to Py_RETURN_NONE here.

comment_regular_data.body:
[![CLA assistant check](https://cla-assistant.io/pull/badge/not_signed)](https://cla-assistant.io/TokTok/py-toxcore-c?pullRequest=30)
Thank you for your submission! We really appreciate it. Like many open source projects, we ask that you sign our [Contributor License Agreement](https://cla-assistant.io/TokTok/py-toxcore-c?pullRequest=30) before we can accept your contribution.
You have signed the CLA already but the status is still pending? Let us [recheck](https://cla-assistant.io/check/TokTok/py-toxcore-c?pullRequest=30) it.
Speaking of tests. Please add one for this function call.
I don't know how to write tests.

https://github.com/TokTok/py-toxcore-c/blob/master/tests/tests.py#L567 here is a use of peer_get_name. Add a use of peer_get_public_key and do some assertions on it. Make sure to also call it with an invalid peer number and catch the exception.

>Now you probably want to Py_RETURN_NONE here.

Done.

>https://github.com/TokTok/py-toxcore-c/blob/master/tests/tests.py#L567 here is a use of peer_get_name. Add a use of peer_get_public_key and do some assertions on it. Make sure to also call it with an invalid peer number and catch the exception.

That sounds hard. Do we really need this?
OH MY GOD... those tests are horrifying...

It always makes me sad when I see more and more tests being created and no new features or fixes to bugs that have been haunting Tox for years. I understand that tests and refactors are important, but what we need the most is features. I don't understand where this sudden focus on tests among some toxcore devs comes from and I don't see why I should do it, while in my opinion there are more important things to do. PyTox is not different - it's incomplete and doesn't work over Tor (maybe does when you use proxy settings). It will be sad if you don't merge this just because of lack of tests.

Ok, so for your next PR, I will not point you at undefined behaviour you're introducing or other mistakes you're making that would have been caught with a 2-5 line test (which is exactly what it would be in this specific case, i.e. less writing than your rant in this comment, and less writing than my response to it).

This isn't about me being lazy, I just don't see a point of doing this. Especially that this is a simple change.

>for your next PR, I will not point you at undefined behaviour you're introducing or other mistakes you're making that would have been caught with a 2-5 line test

I realize that I make mistakes. I'm not saying my code doesn't need review, just that I think we don't have to make tests for every small bit of code. I don't understand why you want this. I've never written a test and I don't know how they work, so maybe I underestimate their value.

@tox-user: https://github.com/TokTok/py-toxcore-c/pull/36/files#diff-61d51a325171d97c8a56e59ea525339bR593 can you add a test like this? I did it for you in the other PR. In this PR, the test will look very similar.
